description: Discuss neccesary precations and possible outcomes of convalescent serum to make sure this is the best solution to the issue. If it's decided that this idea isn't efficient, attempt to implement other solutions mentioned in the article including Nano Silver and ZMapp, which is a mix of antibodies aimed at attacking the virus.
summary: This idea is for WHO, scientists and other organizations related to the EBOLA issue. My take on this article is simple, take action NOW not LATER. Personally, I'm content with the convalescent serum treatment to deal with the virus. It's a simple process which involves taking the blood from individuals who have recovered from the virus and transferring that blood to others who are currently fighting the virus. Aspects to support this solution include the fact that we have implemented this treatment in the past so we have slight knowledge on convalescent serum. Also there is an efficient number of people who have recovered from Ebola which can result in more people being helped. Action should be taken now so the treatment can be efficient.
title: Response To the Article In Science Insider "WHO ponders treating Ebola-infected people with blood of suriviors"
